FuncDef: The reset isis statistics purge-lsp command deletes statistics about purge LSPs of a specified IS-IS process.
CLIs: reset isis statistics purge-lsp [ <process-id> | { vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> } ] [ level-1 | level-2 ]
reset isis [ <process-id> ] statistics purge-lsp [ level-1 | level-2 ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of an IS-IS process.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Deletes statistics about IS-IS purge LSPs of specified VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Deletes statistics about IS-IS Level-1 purge LSPs.
-

Deletes statistics about IS-IS Level-2 purge LSPs.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To locate a problem on an IS-IS network, you can run the reset isis statistics purge-lsp command to delete existing statistics about purge LSPs and then check the latest statistics.
